Headline and Summary Text.description: The UI should display a headline and a summary text in a responsive, mobile-first layout. The headline should be prominent and attention-grabbing, while the summary text should provide a brief overview of the content.

components.name: SummaryTextComponent
components.description: (standalone): displays a brief summary text

Call-to-Action (CTA) Button Section.description: The UI should have a prominent call-to-action (CTA) button section with a bold headline, a brief description, and a prominent CTA button that encourages the user to take action.

components.name: HeadlineComponent
components.description: Standalone component that displays a bold headline text.

components.name: DescriptionComponent
components.description: Standalone component that displays a brief descriptive text.

components.name: CTAButtonComponent
components.description: Standalone component that displays a prominent CTA button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">  {cta_button_text}</button>

Call-to-Action (CTA) Button Section.description: The UI should be a prominent call-to-action (CTA) button section that encourages users to take a specific action. The section should be full-width, with a bold background color, and a contrasting CTA button that stands out. The section should be responsive, with the button size and spacing adjusting based on screen size.

components.name: CTASection
components.description: - standalone component that contains the entire CTA section
components.html:
{headline}

{description}

components.name: CTAButton
components.description: - standalone component that represents the call-to-action button
components.html: <button class="bg-white hover:bg-gray-200 text-orange-500 font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">  {button_text}</button>

Integrations Hub: Connect third-party ap.description: The UI should be a card-based layout that displays a list of integrations. Each card should have a logo of the third-party app, a brief description, and a Connect button. The layout should be responsive, with the cards stacking vertically on mobile devices and displaying in a grid on larger screens.
Integrations Hub: Connect third-party ap.html: Integrations Hub

components.name: IntegrationsList
components.description: A component that takes children (IntegrationCard components) and displays them in a responsive grid.

Integrations Hub: Connect third-party ap.description: The UI should be a card-based layout that displays a list of integrations. Each card should have a logo of the third-party app, a brief description, and a Connect button. The layout should be responsive, with the cards stacking vertically on mobile devices and displaying in a grid on larger screens.
Integrations Hub: Connect third-party ap.html: Integrations Hub

components.name: IntegrationsList
components.description: A component that takes children (IntegrationCard components) and displays them in a responsive grid.

Availability and Pricing Calendars.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first calendar display that shows availability and pricing information for a given period of time. The calendar should have a clear visual distinction between available and unavailable dates, and pricing information should be easily readable.

components.name: AvailabilityCalendar
components.description: standalone component that displays a calendar with available and unavailable dates.

components.name: PricingCalendar
components.description: standalone component that displays a calendar with pricing information for each date.

components.name: CalendarDay
components.description: takes children, represents a single day in the calendar, with available/unavailable and pricing information.

Availability and Pricing Calendars.description: The UI should display a calendar for availability and pricing, showing the dates and corresponding prices. It should have a title, a month selector, and a grid of days with prices.

components.name: MonthSelector
components.description: Standalone component to select the month.
components.html: <select className="py-2 pl-2 pr-4 text-gray-700">  <option value="January">{month_name}</option>  <!-- repeat for each month --></select>

components.name: AvailabilityGrid
components.description: Component that takes children to render the grid of days with prices.

components.name: DayCell
components.description: Standalone component to render a single day with its price.

Search Bar: Input field for searching co.description: The UI should be a simple search bar with an input field and a submit button. The input field should be responsive and adapt to different screen sizes. The search bar should be accessible, with a clear label and a submit button that can be clicked or pressed using the keyboard.

components.name: SearchInput
components.description: a standalone component that represents the input field.
components.html: <input   type="search"   id="search-input"   class="w-full pl-4 pr-10 text-sm text-gray-700"   placeholder="Search..."  aria-label="Search input"/>

components.name: SearchButton
components.description: a standalone component that represents the submit button.
components.html: <button   type="submit"   class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">  {search_button_text}</button>

components.name: SearchIcon
components.description: standalone component that displays a search icon.

components.name: ClearButton
components.description: standalone component that displays a clear button.
components.html: <button class="text-gray-400 hover:text-gray-600 transition duration-300">  <!-- clear icon will go here --></button>

WYSIWYG/Rich Text Editors.description: A simple, minimalistic WYSIWYG/Rich Text Editor with a toolbar at the top and a contenteditable div below it. The toolbar should have buttons for formatting text (bold, italic, underline), aligning text (left, center, right), and inserting links. The contenteditable div should have a placeholder text "Start typing..." and should display the formatted text.

components.description: (takes children) - The contenteditable div that displays the formatted text.

components.description: (standalone) - A single button for formatting text (e.g., bold, italic, underline).

components.name: AlignButton
components.description: (standalone) - A single button for aligning text (e.g., left, center, right).
components.html: <button className="px-2 py-1 border border-gray-200 rounded-lg hover:bg-gray-100">  {align}</button>

components.name: LinkButton
components.description: (standalone) - A button for inserting links.

Server role management with permission e.description: The UI should display a list of server roles with their corresponding permissions. Each role should have an edit button that, when clicked, reveals a permission editor. The permission editor should display a list of available permissions with checkboxes to select or deselect them. The UI should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible.

Tag and Category Navigation.description: The UI should display a navigation menu with tags and categories. The menu should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible. On larger screens, the menu should be displayed horizontally, while on smaller screens, it should be displayed vertically.
Tag and Category Navigation.html:
<nav className="flex flex-wrap justify-center mb-4 lg:flex-no-wrap">
  <NavigationView>
    <!-- category items -->
    <CategoryItem>Category 1</CategoryItem>
    <CategoryItem>Category 2</CategoryItem>
    <!-- tag items -->
    <TagItem>tag 1</TagItem>
    <TagItem>tag 2</TagItem>
  </NavigationView>
</nav>

components.name: TagItem
components.description: a standalone component that displays a single tag.

components.name: CategoryItem
components.description: a standalone component that displays a single category.

components.name: NavigationView
components.description: a component that takes children (tags and categories) to display the navigation menu.

Tag and Category Navigation.description: The UI should display a navigation menu with tags and categories. The menu should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible. On larger screens, the menu should be displayed horizontally, while on smaller screens, it should be displayed vertically.

<nav className="flex flex-wrap justify-center mb-4 lg:flex-no-wrap">

    <!-- tag items -->

</nav>

components.description: a standalone component that displays a single tag.

components.name: CategoryItem

components.name: NavigationView
components.description: a component that takes children (tags and categories) to display the navigation menu.

Tag and Category Navigation.description: The UI should be a navigation bar with two sections: Tags and Categories. Each section should have a header and a list of items. The tags and categories should be clickable.
Tag and Category Navigation.html:
<nav class="flex justify-between">
  <NavItemGroup>
    <NavHeader>Tags</NavHeader>
    <!-- list of tags -->
    <TagNavItem/><TagNavItem/><TagNavItem/>
  </NavItemGroup>
  <NavItemGroup>
    <NavHeader>Categories</NavHeader>
    <!-- list of categories -->
    <CategoryNavItem/><CategoryNavItem/><CategoryNavItem/>
  </NavItemGroup>
</nav>

components.name: NavItemGroup
components.description: a component that takes children, representing a group of navigation items (e.g. Tags or Categories).

components.name: NavHeader
components.description: a standalone component representing a header for a navigation group.

Tag and Category Navigation.description: The UI should display a navigation menu with tags and categories. The menu should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible. On larger screens, the menu should be displayed horizontally, while on smaller screens, it should be displayed vertically.
Tag and Category Navigation.html:
<nav className="flex flex-wrap justify-center mb-4 lg:flex-no-wrap">
  <NavigationView>
    <!-- category items -->
    <CategoryItem>Category 1</CategoryItem>
    <CategoryItem>Category 2</CategoryItem>
    <!-- tag items -->
    <TagItem>tag 1</TagItem>
    <TagItem>tag 2</TagItem>
  </NavigationView>
</nav>

components.description: a standalone component that displays a single tag.

components.name: CategoryItem
components.description: a standalone component that displays a single category.

components.name: NavigationView
components.description: a component that takes children (tags and categories) to display the navigation menu.

Skeleton Screens/Loading.description: A loading UI with a loading animation and a set of skeleton screens for a list of items. The loading animation is a simple rotating wheel and the skeleton screens display a set of rectangles with a slight animation.

Portfolio filter with categories and tag.description: A portfolio filter component that allows users to filter projects by categories and tags. The component consists of two sections: a category filter and a tag filter. Each section has a title, a reset button, and a list of filter options.

components.description: (standalone) - renders a reset button for the filter

Repository Search and Filtering Tool.description: The UI should be a responsive search bar with a dropdown list of repositories that can be filtered by keywords. It should also include a pagination system to navigate through the search results.
Repository Search and Filtering Tool.html:
<main class="max-w-md mx-auto p-4">
  <SearchBar />
  <RepositoryList>
    <!-- repository items will be rendered here -->
  </RepositoryList>
  <Pagination />
</main>

Thread/List View of Topics.description: The UI should be a scrollable list of topics, with each topic displaying its title, description, and some metadata (e.g., author, date created). The list should be ordered by most recent topic first. On smaller screens, the list should be single-column, and on larger screens, it should be a multi-column layout.
Thread/List View of Topics.html: Topics

components.description: (takes children): a container component that renders a list of `TopicCard` components.

Thread/List View of Topics.description: The UI should display a list of topics in a thread/list view, with each topic showing its title, description, and metadata such as the number of replies and views. The list should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible.

Responsive Post Formatting.description: The UI should display a responsive post format that adapts to different screen sizes, with a clear separation between the post's title, metadata, content, and action buttons. The post format should be mobile-first, accessible, and SEO-friendly.

components.name: PostContent
components.description: (standalone): Displays the post's content.

components.name: PostActions
components.description: (standalone): Displays the post's action buttons (e.g., like, comment, share).

components.name: PostContainer
components.description: (takes children): Wraps the entire post format.

Responsive Post Formatting.description: The UI should display a responsive post format that adapts to different screen sizes, with a clear separation between the post's title, metadata, content, and action buttons. The post format should be mobile-first, accessible, and SEO-friendly.

Responsive Post Formatting.description: The UI should display a post in a responsive format, with a title, content, and metadata (author and date). On smaller screens, the metadata should be displayed below the content, and on larger screens, it should be displayed to the side of the content.

components.name: Post
components.description: A standalone component that contains the title, content, and metadata of a post.

components.name: PostMetadata
components.description: A standalone component that displays the author and date of a post.

components.name: PostTitle
components.description: A standalone component that displays the title of a post.

components.name: PostContent
components.description: A standalone component that displays the content of a post.

Responsive Post Formatting.description: The UI should display a responsive post formatting, with a profile picture, username, post text, and actions (like, comment, share). The post should adapt to different screen sizes, with the profile picture and username on the same line on larger screens, and stacked on smaller screens.

components.name: UserProfilePicture
components.description: Standalone component, displays the profile picture of the user who made the post.

components.name: UserName
components.description: Standalone component, displays the username of the user who made the post.

components.name: PostText
components.description: Standalone component, displays the text of the post.

components.name: PostActions
components.description: Standalone component, displays the actions for the post (like, comment, share).

Responsive Post Formatting.description: The UI should display a responsive post formatting with a header, image, content, and footer sections. The post format should be mobile-first and adaptable to different screen sizes.
Responsive Post Formatting.html:
<article class="mb-4 bg-white rounded shadow-md overflow-hidden">
  <PostHeader />
  <PostImage />
  <PostContent>
    <!-- post content will be rendered here -->
  </PostContent>
  <PostFooter />
</article>

components.name: PostImage
components.description: A standalone component that displays the post image.

components.name: PostContent
components.description: A component that displays the post content and takes children.

components.name: PostFooter
components.description: A standalone component that displays the post footer.

Bidding/Auction Functions.description: The UI should display an auction item with its details, current bid, and a bidding form. The design should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible.

components.name: AuctionDetails
components.description: (standalone): displays the auction item details

components.name: CurrentBid
components.description: (standalone): displays the current bid

components.name: BiddingForm
components.description: (takes children): allows users to place a bid

components.name: BidInput
components.description: (standalone): a input field for the bid amount
components.html: <input type="number" class="w-full p-2 border border-gray-200" value={bid_amount} />

components.name: PlaceBidButton
components.description: (standalone): a button to submit the bid
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">  Place Bid</button>

Community Forum and Chat Tools.description: The UI should be a responsive community forum and chat tools page that allows users to discuss topics, ask questions, and interact with each other through a chat system. The page should be divided into two main sections: a forum section that displays a list of discussion topics, and a chat section that allows users to send messages to each other.
Community Forum and Chat Tools.html:
Community Forum

Chat

components.name: ForumTopicCard
components.description: A standalone component that displays a single discussion topic, including the topic title, description, and number of replies.
components.html:
{topicTitle}

{topicDescription}

{replyCount} replies

components.name: ForumTopicList
components.description: A component that takes children (a list of **ForumTopicCard** components) and displays them in a scrollable list.

components.name: ChatInput
components.description: A standalone component that allows users to input and send messages.
components.html: <form class="flex mb-4">  <input type="text" class="w-full p-2 pl-10 text-gray-700" placeholder="Type a message...">  <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Send</button></form>

components.name: ChatMessage

User settings panel with notification an.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first user settings panel with two main sections: notification options and account options. The notification options section should have a heading, a list of toggle switches for different notification types, and a "Save Changes" button. The account options section should have a heading, a list of profile information (e.g. name, email), and an "Edit Profile" button.
User settings panel with notification an.html: User Settings

Task Calendar: Schedule and assign tasks.description: The UI should display a calendar view with a list of tasks, allowing users to schedule and assign tasks to specific dates and team members. The UI should be responsive, with a mobile-first design that adapts to different screen sizes.

components.name: TaskList
components.description: Standalone component that displays a list of tasks.

components.name: TaskCard
components.description: Component that renders a single task, taking `{taskTitle}`, `{taskDescription}`, `{dueDate}`, `{assignedTo}`, and `{status}` as props. Can take children.

components.name: TaskForm
components.description: Standalone component that allows users to create a new task.
components.html: <form class="p-4 mb-4">  <label class="block" for="taskTitle">Task Title:</label>  <input class="w-full p-2" type="text" id="taskTitle" />  <label class="block" for="taskDescription">Task Description:</label>  <textarea class="w-full p-2" id="taskDescription"></textarea>  <DatePicker />  <AssigneeSelect />  <TaskStatusSelect />  <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">    Create Task  </button></form>

components.name: DatePicker
components.description: Standalone component that allows users to select a date.

components.name: AssigneeSelect
components.description: Standalone component that allows users to select a team member to assign a task to.
components.html: <select class="w-full p-2">  <option value="">Select a team member</option>  <!-- Options will be populated dynamically --></select>

components.name: TaskStatusSelect
components.description: Standalone component that allows users to select a task status.
components.html: <select class="w-full p-2">  <option value="">Select a status</option>  <!-- Options will be populated dynamically --></select>

Post Card: A single post with user info.description: The UI should be a card that displays a single post with user information and actions. It should be responsive, mobile-first, accessible, and SEO-friendly. The card should have a clear hierarchy of information, with the user's profile picture, name, and timestamp at the top, followed by the post content, and then the actions (e.g., like, comment, share) at the bottom.

components.name: PostActions
components.description: (standalone): Displays the actions (e.g., like, comment, share) for the post.

components.name: PostCard
components.description: (takes children): The container component that wraps around the user profile, post content, and post actions.

Dependancy Graph Visualization Component.description: The Dependency Graph Visualization Component should display a graph showing the relationships between different dependencies. The graph should be responsive, accessible, and mobile-friendly. The nodes in the graph should be clickable, and when clicked, the node should be highlighted and the related dependencies should be visually emphasized.

components.description: (takes children) - contains the graph and handles node relationships

components.name: TooltipComponent
components.description: (takes children) - displays additional information when a node is hovered or clicked

Search bar for finding products.description: The UI should be a simple search bar with a text input field and a submit button. The search bar should be responsive, taking up the full width on mobile devices and a maximum width of 400px on desktop devices. The input field should have a placeholder text "Search for products...". The submit button should have a search icon and the text "Search".

Email filtering and sorting options.description: The UI should display a set of filtering and sorting options for an email inbox. There should be a dropdown for selecting filters (e.g. "Unread", "Starred", etc.), a dropdown for selecting sorting methods (e.g. "Oldest", "Newest", etc.), and a button to apply the selected filters and sorting.

components.description: (standalone): a dropdown component for selecting sorting methods

components.name: ApplyButton
components.description: (standalone): a button to apply the selected filters and sorting

components.description: (takes children): a container component to hold the filtering and sorting options

Product filtering and sorting controls.description: The UI should display a set of filtering and sorting controls for products, allowing users to narrow down their search results by category, price range, and rating. The controls should be responsive, accessible, and easy to use on various devices.

components.name: PriceRangeSlider
components.description: A standalone component for selecting a price range.
components.html: Min: {min_price} Max: {max_price}

components.name: RatingFilterButtons
components.description: A standalone component for selecting a rating filter.

components.name: SortBySelect
components.description: A standalone dropdown component for selecting a sorting option.
components.html: <select className="bg-white border border-gray-300 rounded-full text-gray-600 py-2 px-4 w-full">  <option value="">Sort by</option>  <option value="price_asc">Price: Low to High</option>  <option value="price_desc">Price: High to Low</option>  <option value="rating_desc">Rating: High to Low</option></select>

components.name: FilterControls
components.description: A container component that takes children ( FilterCategorySelect, PriceRangeSlider, RatingFilterButtons, and SortBySelect ).

Search Bar and Filters.description: The UI should be a search bar with filters, allowing users to search for specific items and filter the results by different criteria. The search bar should be responsive and mobile-friendly, with the filters hidden on smaller screens and revealed on larger screens.

components.description: (standalone): The submit button for the search.

Post/Tweet Embeds.description: The UI should display a post or tweet embed with the author's name, profile picture, post content, and other relevant details. It should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible.

components.name: PostContent
components.description: standalone component to display the post content.

components.name: PostMetadata
components.description: standalone component to display additional metadata such as the post date and EngagementButton.

components.name: EngagementButton
components.description: standalone component to display the engagement options (e.g., like, retweet, reply).

components.name: PostEmbed
components.description: takes children to wrap the entire post embed.

Related Project Suggestions.description: The UI should be a list of suggested projects, each with a title, description, and a "View Project" button. The list should be displayed in a grid format, with 2-3 columns on larger screens and 1 column on smaller screens.
Related Project Suggestions.html: Related Projects

components.name: ProjectSuggestionsList
components.description: a component that takes children, displaying a list of `ProjectSuggestionCard`s.

components.name: PostComments
components.description: A standalone component that displays the comments of the post.

Quiz and Assessment Tools.description: The UI should be a responsive and accessible quiz and assessment tools page that presents a series of questions with multiple-choice answers. The page should be easy to navigate, with clear labels and instructions.
Quiz and Assessment Tools.html:
<main class="max-w-md mx-auto p-4 lg:p-6">
  <QuizHeader />
  <section class="flex flex-wrap -mx-4">
    <QuestionCard>
      <!-- question content will be inserted here -->
    </QuestionCard>
    <!-- more QuestionCard components will be inserted here -->
  </section>
  <SubmitButton />
  <FeedbackMessage />
</main>

Radio/Checkbox Inputs.description: A simple form with radio and checkbox inputs, with clear labels and accessible markup.
Radio/Checkbox Inputs.html:
<form className="max-w-md mx-auto p-4">
  <FormGroup>
    <RadioInput label="Option 1" name="radio-group" value="option1" />
    <RadioInput label="Option 2" name="radio-group" value="option2" />
    <RadioInput label="Option 3" name="radio-group" value="option3" />
  </FormGroup>
  <FormGroup>
    <CheckboxInput label="Checkbox 1" name=" checkbox1" />
    <CheckboxInput label="Checkbox 2" name="checkbox2" />
    <CheckboxInput label="Checkbox 3" name="checkbox3" />
  </FormGroup>
</form>

Profile Picture and Header Image.description: The UI should have a profile picture and a header image that takes up the full width of the screen. On mobile, the profile picture should be circular and centered, with the header image below it. On larger screens, the profile picture should be circular and aligned to the left, with the header image taking up the rest of the width.

Personalized Dashboard with Project Insi.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first, and accessible personalized dashboard that displays project insights. The dashboard should have a clean and minimalistic design, with clear typography and sufficient whitespace. It should display key project metrics, such as project completion percentage, task lists, and upcoming deadlines. The dashboard should also have a section for quick links to frequently accessed project resources.

components.name: ProjectMetrics
components.description: (standalone): Displays key project metrics, such as project completion percentage and upcoming deadlines.
components.html: Project Metrics

components.name: TaskList
components.description: (takes children): Displays a list of tasks with checkboxes and task names.

components.name: QuickLinks
components.description: (standalone): Displays a list of quick links to frequently accessed project resources.
components.html:
Quick Links

  • Link 1
  • Link 2

Rating and Review Systems.description: The UI should display an average rating (e.g., 4.5/5) with a visual representation of the rating (e.g., stars), followed by a list of reviews. Each review should display the reviewer's name, rating (with a visual representation of the rating), and the review text.
Rating and Review Systems.html:
Average rating: {average_rating}/5

{reviews.map(review => ( {review.text} ))}

components.name: Review
components.description: A component that takes children (the review text) and displays a single review with the reviewer's name, rating, and review text.

components.name: RatingAndReviews
components.description: A component that takes children (the list of reviews) and displays the average rating and the list of reviews.

Rating and Review Systems.description: The UI should be a rating and review system that displays the average rating and allows users to leave their own ratings and reviews. It should be responsive and accessible.

components.description: Standalone component to input a rating (e.g., 1-5 stars).
components.html: {rating} / 5 stars

components.description: Component that takes children to display a list of reviews.
components.html: {children}

components.name: ReviewCard
components.description: Standalone component to display a single review.

components.name: ReviewForm
components.description: Standalone component to input a new review.
components.html: <form class="mb-4">  <label class="block mb-2" for="review">Leave a review</label>  <textarea id="review" class="w-full p-2" placeholder="Write a review..."></textarea>  <RatingInput />  <button class="bg-blue-500 hover:bg-blue-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Submit</button></form>

Header: Site title and navigation links.description: The UI should be a header section at the top of the webpage, featuring a site title on the left side and navigation links on the right side. The site title should be prominent and centered on mobile devices, while the navigation links should be stacked on top of each other on mobile devices and aligned horizontally on larger screens.
Header: Site title and navigation links.html:
<header>
  <Header>
    <SiteTitle />
    <NavLinks>
      <NavLink />
      <NavLink />
      <!-- Add more NavLink components as needed -->
    </NavLinks>
  </Header>
</header>

components.name: NavLinks
components.description: (takes children): a container for multiple `NavLink` components

components.name: Header
components.description: (takes children): the top-level component that contains the site title and navigation links

Custom Field Builder: Create tailored da.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first, and accessible interface for building custom data fields. It should consist of a header, a field-type selection section, and a field configuration section. The header should display the title "Custom Field Builder" and have an optional "Save" button. The field-type selection section should display a list of available field types (e.g., text, number, date, etc.). The field configuration section should display fields depending on the selected field type.

components.name: FieldTypeSelectorComponent
components.description: (standalone): Displays a list of available field types.

components.name: FieldConfiguratorComponent
components.description: (takes children): Displays fields depending on the selected field type.
components.html: <!-- field configuration fields will be rendered here based on the selected field type -->{children}

Category Navigation.description: The category navigation UI should display a list of categories in a horizontal layout on desktop and a vertical layout on mobile devices. Each category should be a clickable item with a label and an optional icon. The active category should be visually highlighted.
Category Navigation.html:
<nav class="flex flex-wrap justify-center md:flex-nowrap md:justify-start">
  <CategoryNav>
    <CategoryNavItem>Category 1</CategoryNavItem>
    <CategoryNavItem>Category 2</CategoryNavItem>
    <CategoryNavItem>Category 3</CategoryNavItem>
    <!-- Add more categories here -->
  </CategoryNav>
</nav>

components.description: (standalone): A single category item in the navigation list.
components.html: • {icon} {label}

components.name: CategoryNav
components.description: (takes children): The container component that wraps the list of category items.

Message input field with send button and.description: A responsive, mobile-first input field with a send button and an emoji picker. The input field should be accessible and SEO-friendly. On mobile devices, the input field should take up the full width of the screen, and the send button should be anchored to the right side of the screen. On larger screens, the input field should have a maximum width, and the send button should be aligned to the right of the input field. The emoji picker should be a popup that appears below the input field when the emoji button is clicked.

components.name: SendButton
components.description: (standalone): the button that sends the message

Pull Request Management System.description: The UI should display a list of pull requests, each with its title, description, and status (e.g. "Open", "In Review", "Merged"). The list should be sorted by the most recent update time. Each pull request item should have buttons to view details, approve, and reject.
Pull Request Management System.html: Pull Requests

Comment Thread: Display comments and rep.description: The UI should be a responsive comment thread that displays comments and their replies in a hierarchical structure. The design should be mobile-first, accessible, and SEO-friendly. Each comment should have an avatar, username, comment text, and a reply button. Replies should be indented and have a different background color to differentiate them from top-level comments.

components.description: (standalone) - A single pagination button (e.g. "Prev", "Next", etc.).
components.html: <button class="bg-gray-200 hover:bg-gray-300 text-gray-800 font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">{button_label}</button>

components.name: LoadMoreButton
components.description: (standalone) - The "Load more" button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">{load_more_label}</button>

components.name: ListItem
components.description: (takes children) - A single item in the list.

Cookie Banners.description: A cookie banner is a notification that appears at the top or bottom of a webpage, informing users about the use of cookies on the website. It should be a non-obtrusive, dismissible notification that contains a message, an accept button, and an optional link to learn more.

components.name: CookieBanner
components.description: Standalone component that contains the cookie banner message, accept button, and optional link.
components.html:
{cookie_message}

{optional_link && ( {optional_link.text} )}

components.name: CookieButton
components.description: Standalone component that represents the accept button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Accept</button>

Each teaser should have a subtle background color and padding to differentiate it from the others.

Tweet display for individual posts.description: The UI should display an individual tweet with the user's profile picture, name, username, timestamp, tweet text, and optional media (e.g., images or videos). The design should be responsive, accessible, and visually appealing, with clear typography and sufficient whitespace.
Tweet display for individual posts.html:
<article class="max-w-md mx-auto pb-4 mb-4 bg-white rounded-md shadow-md">
  <TweetHeader />
  <TweetTimestamp />
  <TweetText />
  <TweetMedia>
    <!-- Optional media content -->
  </TweetMedia>
  <TweetFooter />
</article>

components.description: A standalone component that displays a grid of game tiles.
components.html: { /* an 4x4 grid of GameTile components */ }

components.name: GameTile
components.description: A component that takes children (the tile's value and optional "locked" indicator) and displays a single game tile.
components.html:
{tile_value}

{locked && (Locked)} {children}

Switches/Toggles/Buttons.description: A toggle button, a switch, and a button, each with a different style, layout, and purpose.

components.name: ToggleSwitch
components.description: A toggle switch component that can be either on or off. Standalone.

components.name: SwitchButton
components.description: A switch button component that can be either enabled or disabled. Standalone.
components.html: <button class="bg-{color}-500 hover:bg-{color}-700 text-white hover:text-white py-2 px-4 rounded">  {label}</button>

components.name: ActionButton
components.description: A button component that can be clicked to perform an action. Standalone.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white hover:text-white py-2 px-4 rounded">  {label}</button>

Code Review and Approval Workflow.description: The UI should display a vertical timeline of code review and approval workflow, with each step represented by a circular icon and a brief description. The timeline should be responsive and adaptable to different screen sizes.

components.name: Timeline
components.description: A component that takes children, which are `CodeReviewStep` components.

Hero Image/Header.description: The UI should display a hero image/header section that takes up the full width of the screen, with a background image, a heading, and a call-to-action (CTA) button. The heading and CTA button should be centered horizontally and vertically within the hero image.

components.name: HeroImageHeader
components.description: (standalone)

components.name: HeroHeading
components.description: (standalone)

components.name: CallToAction
components.description: (standalone)
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">{cta_text}</button>

components.description: standalone component to display a generic message (can be used for error or success messages)
components.html: {message} {message_details}

Features Grid: Highlight key benefits in.description: A responsive grid layout with 3-4 columns, showcasing key benefits of a product or service. Each grid item should have an icon, a heading, and a brief description.
Features Grid: Highlight key benefits in.html:
<section class="container mx-auto p-4 lg:p-8">
  <FeaturesGrid>
    <FeatureItem/>
    <FeatureItem/>
    <FeatureItem/>
    <!-- Add more FeatureItem components as needed -->
  </FeaturesGrid>
</section>

components.name: FeaturesGrid
components.description: (takes children): The container element for the feature items, managing the grid layout.

Threaded Commenting and Nesting.description: The UI should display a list of comments with threading and nesting. Each comment should have a username, a comment text, and a reply button. When the reply button is clicked, a new comment input field should appear below the comment, allowing the user to respond to the comment. The nested comments should be indented to show the hierarchy of the conversation.

components.name: CommentThread
components.description: A standalone component that displays a list of comments with threading and nesting.

components.name: Comment
components.description: A standalone component that displays a single comment with a reply button.
components.html:
{userName}

{commentText}

components.description: A standalone component that displays a text input field for entering a new comment.

components.name: ReplyButton
components.description: A standalone component that displays a button to reply to a comment.
components.html: <button class="bg-gray-200 hover:bg-gray-300 text-gray-800 py-1 px-2 rounded">  Reply</button>

Single post with text, image, and commen.description: A single post UI should display a header with a post title, a container for the post text, an image, and a section for comments.   <PostText/>
  <PostImage/>
  <CommentSection>

  </CommentSection>
</article>

Live streaming tools with real-time chat.description: The UI should be a responsive, mobile-first layout with a live streaming video player on one side and a real-time chat window on the other side. The chat window should display a list of chat messages, with the most recent messages at the bottom. The UI should be accessible, with clear typography, sufficient color contrast, and keyboard-navigable interactive elements.

components.name: LiveStreamPlayer
components.description: Standalone component that displays the live streaming video.

components.name: RealTimeChat
components.description: Standalone component that displays the real-time chat window.
components.html: Live Chat

components.name: ChatMessage
components.description: Component that displays a single chat message, takes children (message text and timestamp).
components.html:
{username} {timestamp}

{children}

components.name: ChatInput
components.description: Standalone component that allows users to input and send chat messages.
components.html: <form class="flex p-2">  <input type="text" class="w-full p-2" placeholder="Type a message...")  <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Send</button></form>

Coupon/Discount Codes.description: A clean and simple coupon/discount code input field with a submit button. The input field should be accompanied by a label and a description. The submit button should be prominent and accessible.

components.name: CouponCodeInput
components.description: Standalone component that renders a single input field for the coupon/discount code.
components.html: <input type="text" id="coupon-code" class="block w-full pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700" />

components.name: SubmitButton
components.description: Standalone component that renders a submit button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Apply Code</button>

components.name: CouponCodeLabel
components.description: Standalone component that renders a label for the input field.
components.html: <label for="coupon-code" class="block text-sm font-bold mb-2">Enter your coupon code:</label>

components.name: DescriptionText
components.description: Standalone component that renders a small text description.
components.html: Enter a valid coupon code to receive your discount.

components.html: <input type="text" id="coupon-code" class="block w-full pl-10 text-sm text-gray-700" />

components.name: SubmitButton
components.description: Standalone component that renders a submit button.
components.html: <button class="bg-orange-500 hover:bg-orange-700 text-white font-bold py-2 px-4 rounded">Apply Code</button>

components.name: CouponCodeLabel
components.description: Standalone component that renders a label for the input field.
components.html: <label for="coupon-code" class="block text-sm font-bold mb-2">Enter your coupon code:</label>

components.name: DescriptionText
components.description: Standalone component that renders a small text description.
components.html: Enter a valid coupon code to receive your discount.

Opportunity Tracker: Monitor sales pipel.description: The Opportunity Tracker UI should display a list of sales pipeline opportunities, with each opportunity showing its name, stage, and probability of closing. The UI should be responsive, mobile-first, and accessible. It should also have a clear hierarchy of information and sufficient whitespace to improve readability.
Opportunity Tracker: Monitor sales pipel.html: Opportunity Tracker

components.name: OpportunityTracker
components.description: A standalone component that displays a list of opportunities.

components.name: OpportunityCard
components.description: A standalone component that displays a single opportunity.
components.html: {opportunity.name}

components.name: StageBadge
components.description: A standalone component that displays the stage of an opportunity.

components.name: ProbabilityBadge
components.description: A standalone component that displays the probability of an opportunity closing.

Product Image Gallery: Showcase your pro.description: The UI should display a product image gallery with multiple images showcasing the product from different angles. The gallery should be responsive, accessible, and SEO-friendly. On mobile devices, the gallery should be swipeable, and on desktop devices, it should have navigation arrows.

components.name: ProductImageGallery
components.description: The main component that contains the image gallery. This component takes children.
components.html: {children}

components.name: ProductImage
components.description: A single image in the gallery. This component is standalone.

components.name: NavigationArrow
components.description: An arrow button for navigating through the images. This component is standalone.

Semantic HTML5 Markup.description: The UI should be a basic web page with a header, navigation, main content area, and footer. The layout should be responsive and mobile-friendly.
Semantic HTML5 Markup.html:
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
    <title>{title}</title>
  </head>
  <body class="min-h-screen flex flex-col">
    <HeaderComponent />
    <NavigationComponent />
    <main class="flex-1">
      <MainComponent>
        <!-- child components will be rendered here -->
      </MainComponent>
    </main>
    <FooterComponent />
  </body>
</html>

components.name: NavigationComponent
components.description: (standalone) - A list of links to other parts of the site.
components.html:
• {nav_text_1}
  • {nav_text_2}

components.name: MainComponent
components.description: (takes children) - The main content area of the page, containing articles, images, or other content.

components.name: FooterComponent
components.description: (standalone) - The bottommost section of the page, containing copyright information and other miscellaneous links.

Semantic HTML5 Markup.description: A basic HTML5 document structure with semantic meaning, containing a header, navigation, main content area, sidebar, and footer.
Semantic HTML5 Markup.html:
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
    <title>{document_title}</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <HeaderComponent />
    <NavComponent />
    <main>
      <MainComponent>
        <!-- Main content area -->
      </MainComponent>
    </main>
    <aside>
      <SidebarComponent />
    </aside>
    <FooterComponent />
  </body>
</html>
